intro: Draba jamesonii, commonly known as Jameson's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. It produces a basal rosette of leaves and has a short, flowering stem that bears white or pale yellow flowers. Draba jamesonii is an important component of alpine ecosystems, contributing to biodiversity and soil stabilization in its habitat.
